[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdateResponse] [Author consistency] Is there validation that ObservedUpdateResponse.update.author matches the network sender, or can validators proxy responses for other validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedKeyLevelUpdate] [Authorization per issuer] Are validators authorized to observe JWKs for all issuers, or should there be per-issuer access control to prevent unauthorized key updates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdate] [Author change after signing] Can the author field be modified after signature verification, allowing validators to reassign observations to different authors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdate] [Validator retirement] If a validator is removed mid-epoch, can their ObservedUpdate messages still contribute to quorum, or are they immediately invalidated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedKeyLevelUpdate] [Cross-epoch author reuse] Can the same author AccountAddress be reused across epochs, and if so, can signature replay allow old observations to be counted in new epochs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdate] [System account abuse] Can system accounts or reserved addresses be used as authors to bypass normal validator authorization checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdateRequest] [Request authorization] Are ObservedUpdateRequest messages restricted to validators, or can any network participant request JWK observations, enabling reconnaissance attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdateRequest] [Issuer enumeration] Can attackers enumerate all possible Issuer values by sending ObservedUpdateRequest messages to discover which OIDC providers are configured? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedKeyLevelUpdateRequest] [KID injection attack] Can malicious KID values with special characters or escape sequences cause injection vulnerabilities when processed or logged? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdateRequest] [Issuer confusion] If multiple issuers have similar names, can attackers exploit confusion to update wrong issuer's keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedKeyLevelUpdateRequest] [KID collision] Can attackers create key updates with colliding KID values to overwrite legitimate keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdate] [Issuer validation missing] Is the Issuer in ProviderJWKs validated against a whitelist of approved OIDC providers, or can arbitrary issuers be added to the system? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedKeyLevelUpdate] [KID length attack] Can unbounded KID string length cause buffer overflows or memory exhaustion when storing or comparing key identifiers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdateRequest] [Case sensitivity] Are Issuer comparisons case-sensitive, and can attackers exploit case differences to bypass rate limiting or create duplicate issuer entries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedKeyLevelUpdateRequest] [Missing KID] Can ObservedKeyLevelUpdateRequest be created with empty or null KID, causing key lookups to fail or return wrong keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdate] [Issuer URL manipulation] If Issuer contains URLs, can attackers use URL manipulation (path traversal, query parameters) to bypass issuer validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedKeyLevelUpdateRequest] [KID wildcard abuse] Can wildcard or regex patterns in KID be exploited to match multiple keys simultaneously, causing batch updates with single signature? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Enum: ConsensusState] [Concurrent state transitions] If ConsensusState is accessed from multiple async tasks without locking, can race conditions cause it to be in inconsistent intermediate states? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: QuorumCertProcessGuard] [Concurrent drops] If multiple threads drop QuorumCertProcessGuard clones concurrently, can the AbortHandle be aborted multiple times causing double-abort or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Enum: ConsensusState::InProgress] [TOCTOU in proposal] Can the my_proposal be checked in one task but modified by another before being used, creating time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdate] [Concurrent signature verification] If multiple threads verify the same ObservedUpdate signature concurrently, can race conditions in BLS signature verification code cause false positives or negatives? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Enum: ConsensusState::Finished] [Double commitment] Can two tasks both transition to Finished state and commit different QuorumCertifiedUpdate values due to race conditions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: QuorumCertProcessGuard] [Clone-drop race] When QuorumCertProcessGuard is cloned and the original is dropped, can the clone still be used safely, or does the AbortHandle become invalid? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Enum: ConsensusState] [Non-atomic reads] If ConsensusState fields are read without atomic operations, can partially updated states be observed during concurrent writes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/types.rs] [Struct: ObservedUpdateResponse] [Concurrent accumulation] When collecting ObservedUpdateResponse messages from multiple validators concurrently, can race conditions cause duplicate counting or lost messages? (High)
